abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Project Completion Report
            (PCR) for the Fourth Agro-industries Credit Project in
            Brazil. The PCR concludes that the project had good overall
            results, noting that a majority of the sub-projects are
            performing well. As per the Operation Evaluation Department
            (OED), the outcome of the project is unsatisfactory with
            sustainability as uncertain. Institutional impact was
            negligible. The project aimed to support productive
            agro-industrial investments, and to liberalize credit in the
            agricultural sector, with a US$300 million loan mostly for
            local expenditures. Despite an encouraging start, and
            general success in exceeding the target reduction of
            official credit for agro-industry, the National Program of
            Agro-Industrial Development (PNDA) experienced several
            problems during implementation. These problems resulted from
            (i) the project's two-stage implementation and problems
            in indexing and pricing sub-loans; (ii) the consequences for
            Secretaria do Tesouro Nacional - National Treasury
            Secretariat (STN), PBs, and beneficiaries of delays in
            replenishing the Special Account; and (iii) the pace of
            commitments to refinance and associated foreign-exchange
            losses for STN. Lessons learned are as follows :(a) All
            future lending should be in US dollars to minimize the
            impact of exchange rate fluctuations on the value of
            sub-loans and flow of repayments to STN. (b) Participation
            can and should be broadened. Although more than 50
            Participating Bank (PBs) had been accredited by Banco
            Central do Brasil - Central Bank of Brazil (BACEN), only
            fourteen actually participated in the project. (c) Local
            project supervision should be improved by making the various
            data bases on PNDA disbursements compatible with one
            another. (d) STN should take steps to provide information on
            loan implementation and, results, as requested by the Bank.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth Agro - Industries Credit
            Project is an integral part of a strategy aimed at
            transferring dependence from the offical credit system to
            voluntary commercial lending in the agricultural sector. THe
            loan funds will be used by the Government to refinance
            subloans made by accredited participating banks to
            agroindustrial enterprises to finance the latters investment
            and associated working capital requirements. The terms on
            which the Treasury of the Ministry of Finance will refinance
            these subloans will be designed to enable the Government to
            recover from the participating banks (PBs) the full costs of
            obtaining and administrating the Bank loan. The terms on
            which the PBs would lend to their customers would be a
            market outcome and, therefore, based essentially on the
            PB's refinancing costs plus a spread as determined by
            the market.
